author: fabiocos
body:
The density of composite materials is defined in tkLayout according to the mass of each elementary material associated to a specific volume. At present this provides some odd results for MTD, and in particular for some ETL hybrid component (68 g/cm3 !).

Pending a revision of the composite structure, I recompute the composite densities according to their elements' density and declared mass fraction, so as to get formally meaningful numbers.
title: Fix MTD composite densities according to fractions and element density
